{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 2-year-old boy with unsteady gait, frequent falls, and twitching of the extremities. Physical examination reveals saccadic eye movement and involuntary muscle contractions. There is also an ill-defined mass in the upper right abdomen. Given these findings, the most likely diagnosis is a neuroblastoma, which is a common tumor in young children. Neuroblastomas are characterized by small blue cells arranged in rosettes around a central neuropil. Therefore, the histopathologic examination of the mass is most likely to show small blue cells arranged in rosettes around a central neuropil.", "answer_choice": "C"}
